Circle¶

class Circle¶

A circle in a two-dimensional plane.

__init__(center, radius)¶

Create an instance of a Circle based on a center and radius.

Parameters:

  • center (Point) – the center of the circle

  • radius – the radius of the circle

property center¶

The center of the circle.

property radius¶

The radius of the circle.

__repr__()¶

Return string representation of this circle.

>>> a = Circle(Point(0, 0), 5)
>>> a
Circle(center=(0, 0), radius=5)
Returns:

string representation of this circle

__str__()¶

Return string representation of this circle, in the form of an equation.

>>> a = Circle(Point(0, 0), 5)
>>> print(a)
(x-(0))^2 + (y-(0))^2 = (5)^2
Returns:

string representation of this circle in an equation

__contains__(pt)¶

Return whether or not pt is on this circle.

>>> a = Circle(Point(0, 0), 5)
>>> Point(3, -4) in a
True
>>> Point(4, -4) in a
False
Parameters:

pt (Point) – the point to test

Returns:

whether the point is on this circle

intersect(l)¶

Return a list of intersection point(s) between this circle and a line.

>>> a = Circle(Point(3, 4), 5)
>>> a.intersect(Line(Point(0, 10), Point(1, 10)))
[]
>>> a.intersect(Line(Point(0, 9), Point(1, 9)))
[Point(3, 9)]
>>> a.intersect(Line(Point(0, 0), Point(1, 0)))
[Point(6, 0), Point(0, 0)]
Parameters:

l (Line) – the line to intersect with

Returns:

a list of intersection point(s)
